revised_title: Observations on the Viscous Theory of Glacier Motion and Seasonal Influences
tldr: The author investigates the rate of motion in small isolated glacial masses, or 'glaciers of the second order,' and examines the influence of slope, mass, and seasonal factors on their movement. The study focuses on the Schonhorn glacier near the Simplon hospice, where the author measures the velocity of the glacier's movement and discusses the implications of these findings for the viscous theory of glacier motion.
